result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Rae Stirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda Rae Stirk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda Rae Stirk was found guilty of Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Jail credit of 25 days in the event of revocation

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Comply with other treatment recommendations by the agent.
*No contact with Jesse Withers

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Rae Stirk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda Rae Stirk in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CF250, 16CF48  
2:53 p.m.  Court calls the case.   

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files restitution summary.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court questions the defendant. 

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF250.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

16CF48 Count 3 is dismissed. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF250 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
No jail credit. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Comply with any assessments recommended by the agent and any treatment identified by her agent as necessary to her rehabilitation. 
Pay costs and surcharges. 
Pay restitution of $1,200.00 joint and several with co-defendant Withers.  Pay before being discharged from probation which may be extended by DOC if necessary. 

16CF48 Count 3 is dismissed.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on July 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Letter to Br 2 Judge in re:  resolution of Count 3

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda Rae Stirk in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 16CF-48, 15CT-132 and 16CF-196.

3:29 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed, except for 15CT-132.

There is a plea agreement.
16CF-48: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 dismissed
16CF-196: Defendant will plead to Count 1.
15CT-132 would be dismissed and read in

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 16CF-48
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 16CF-196

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kessler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CF-48: Count 1: Found Guilty
16CF-48: Count 2: Dismissed and read in
16CF-196: Count 1: Found Guilty
15CT-132: Dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court addresses the parties, believes the recommendation is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
16CF-48:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Jail credit for 25 days in the event of a revocation
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs and surcharges
Pay DNA Surcharge
Obtain an AODA and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other treatment recommendations by the agent
No contact with Jesse Withers

16CF-196: 
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 days
Court grants ability to serve the jail sentence in Wood County if the jail there can work it out
First half in custody, balance may be served on electronic home monitoring
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs and surcharges
60 days in which to pay the costs

Any bond posted is to be applied to costs/surcharges in the cases.
Count 3 Added

Defendant Amanda Rae Stirk in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Defendant Amanda Rae Stirk in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:17 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a bond modification hearing.

Atty Cousins received a copy of the letter that was filed with the Court.

Court takes a moment to re-review the letter.

Atty Kessler addresses the Court, requesting bond modification for reasons stated on the record, requests cash bond be reduced to $500.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, requesting Court to not modify bond, for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Kessler responds.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court amends bond to $2,000 signature. Post $500 cash. Day report twice a week. Do not drive unless have a valid drivers license, along with all the other jail bond conditions.
